thread.title: Rio Ferdinand has very high hopes for Manchester United as he posts nostalgic Premier League title parade video
thread.title_full: Rio Ferdinand has very high hopes for Manchester United as he posts nostalgic Premier League title parade video

author: Jake Polden
title: Rio Ferdinand has very high hopes for Manchester United as he posts nostalgic Premier League title parade video
text:
Sport Rio Ferdinand has very high hopes for Manchester United as he posts nostalgic Premier League title parade video The Red Devils legend is confident Jose Mourinho is the man to bring the glory back to Manchester United Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Rio Ferdinand posts throwback 2013 title celebrations vid Share this video Get daily     
Rio Ferdinand has very high hopes for this Manchester United side. 
The Red Devils legend took to social media to post a nostalgic video from the 2012/13 season, in which United won their 20th English league title. 
He explained that he expects Jose Mourinho's boys to be celebrating in this way very soon - although he does admit that it's probably unlikely to be this season. 
The Red Devils eased into the last-16 of the Europa League with a 4-0 aggregate win over St Etienne on Wednesday night. Rio Ferdinand, also known as Mr Manchester United (Photo: Michael Regan) 
But it seems the club's former centre-back saw the result as a dot on the card, because he had already posted the above clip to his social media account. 
In the video, Ferdinand can be seen shouting through a microphone while standing on an open-top bus during Man United's title parade in 2013. 
He inspires the crowd to sing "we got our trophy back" and also takes the opportunity to serenade his then defensive partner Nemanja Vidic, as well as Paul Scholes and Wayne Rooney. Ferdinand expects to see this in Manchester very soon (Photo: Getty) Ferdinand gets the crowd going in 2013 (Photo: Getty) 
Writing alongside the clip, he said: "Maybe Premier League Champions is asking a bit much. 
"But I have a feeling the Manchester United team and fans will be doing a bit of this soon..." 
Watch this space. Will Jose Mourinho win a Premier League title at Manchester United? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
